title: School Prospectus School of Nursing, Allied Health, and Biological Sciences (SONAHBS)
name: School of Nursing, Allied Health, and Biological Sciences (SONAHBS)
vision_mission: The School of Nursing, Allied Health, and Biological Sciences (SONAHBS) envisions itself as a seat of excellence in Nursing, Allied Health, and Biological Sciences education—dynamic and inspired by a Christian way of living, producing globally competitive and value-laden nurses and healthcare professionals in the service of humanity.
history: Reunification of the School of Natural Sciences (formerly College of Natural Science, separated from Liberal Arts in 1968)
and the School of Nursing (separated from the College of Natural Sciences in 1976)
general_goals_objectives: Prepare graduates for nursing and healthcare practice in various settings.
Provide a broad cultural and professional education.
Develop Christian values and leadership qualities for societal contribution.
allied_health_bio_objectives: Uphold human values in a learning environment of unity and respect.
Develop professionals through analysis of life’s building blocks.
Conduct relevant basic and applied research.
Engage in health and environmental issues.
Sustain long-term growth through creativity and innovation.
program_offerings: Bachelor of Science in Biology (BS Biol)
Bachelor of Science in Medical Laboratory Science (BSMLS)
Bachelor of Science in Pharmacy (BS Pharm)
Bachelor of Science in Radiologic Technology (BSRT)

contact_info.location: Jose Rizal Building / Diego Silang Building, SLU Main Campus, Baguio City, Philippines

admission_info: For general admission requirements and enrollment procedures, contact the SONAHBS Office or visit SLU's official website.
student_organizations: For the list of recognized student organizations under SONAHBS, please check the official SLU SONAHBS Facebook Page or contact the office directly.
